tags.name: System API
tags.description: This group contains functions related to whole system (all servers).

tags.name: Server API
tags.description: This group contains functions related to a single server.

tags.name: Video API
tags.description: This group contains information about accessing cameras" live video and footage.

tags.name: Proxy API
tags.description: This group contains information requests proxy from one server to another.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Request authentication methods supported by server.

get.description: Read bookmarks using the specified parameters.

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description:
Start time of the interval with bookmarks (in milliseconds
since epoch). Default value is 0. Should be less than endTime.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description:
End time of the interval with bookmarks (in milliseconds since
epoch). Default value is the current time. Should be greater than startTime.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Field to sort the results by. Default value is "startTime".

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sort order. Default order is ascending.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of bookmarks to return. Unlimited by default.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Text-search filter string.

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

parameters.name: extraFormatting
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

get.description: Add a bookmark to the target server.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Identifier of the bookmark.

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Caption of the bookmark.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Details of the bookmark.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time during which the recorded period should be preserved (in
milliseconds).

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Start time of the bookmark (in milliseconds since epoch).

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Length of the bookmark (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Applied tag. Several tag parameters could be used to specify multiple tags.

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

parameters.name: extraFormatting
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

get.description: Remove a bookmark with the specified identifier.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Identifier of the bookmark.

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

parameters.name: extraFormatting
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

get.description: Return currently used tags.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tags to return.

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

parameters.name: extraFormatting
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

parameters.name: format

get.description: Update information for a bookmark.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Identifier of the bookmark.

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Caption of the bookmark.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Details of the bookmark.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time during which the recorded period should be preserved (in
milliseconds).

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Start time of the bookmark (in milliseconds since epoch).

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Length of the bookmark (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description:
Applied tag. Serveral tag parameters could be used to specify
multiple tags.

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

parameters.name: extraFormatting
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

get.description: Get the static image from the camera.

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
Timestamp of the requested image (in milliseconds since epoch).
The special value "latest", which is the default value, requires to retrieve the latest
thumbnail. The special value "now" requires to retrieve the thumbnail corresponding to
the current time.

parameters.name: rotate
parameters.description:
Image orientation. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees. If the
parameter is absent or equals -1, the image will be rotated as defined in the camera
settings.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description:
Desired image height. Should be not less than 128, or equal to
-1 (the default value) which implies the original frame size, and in this case the width
should also be omitted or set to -1.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description:
Desired image width. Should be not less than 128, or equal to -1
(the default value) which implies autosizing: if the height is specified, the width will
be calculated based on the aspect ratio, otherwise, the original frame size will be
used.

parameters.name: imageFormat
parameters.description: Format of the requested image. Default value is "JpgFormat".

parameters.name: roundMethod
parameters.description:
Getting a thumbnail at the exact timestamp is costly, so, it
can be rounded to the nearest keyframe, thus, the default value is
"KeyFrameAfterMethod".

parameters.name: aspectRatio
parameters.description:
Allows to avoid scaling the image to the aspect ratio from
camera settings.

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

parameters.name: extraFormatting
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

post.description:
Proprietary.

Execute an action. Action data should be in the internal binary format. This method is going to be refactored in next versions.

default.description: XML with the "OK" message or an error code.

get.description: Return list of ids of accessible resources for each user in the System.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

default.description: List of access rights data objects in the requested format.

get.description:
Read information about which server was hosting the camera at which period.
This information is used for archive playback if camera has been moved from
one server to another.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

default.description: List of camera history items in the requested format.

get.description: Read additional camera attributes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id", "physicalId" or "logicalId"
field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not
supported for certain cameras). If omitted, return data for all cameras.

default.description:
List of objects with additional camera attributes for all cameras, in the requested
format.

userDefinedGroupName.description: Name of the user-defined camera group.

scheduleEnabled.description: Whether recording to the archive is enabled for the camera.

licenseUsed.description: Whether the license is used for the camera.

motionMask.description:
List of motion detection areas and their
sensitivity. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in
future API versions. Currently, this string defines several rectangles separated
with ":", each rectangle is described by 5 comma-separated numbers: sensitivity,
x and y (for left top corner), width, height.

scheduleTasks.description:
List of scheduleTask objects which define the camera recording
schedule.

startTime.description:
Time of day when the backup starts (in seconds
passed from 00:00:00).

endTime.description:
Time of day when the backup ends (in seconds passed
from 00:00:00).

beforeThreshold.description:
The number of seconds before a motion event
to record the video for.

afterThreshold.description:
The number of seconds after a motion event to
record the video for.

audioEnabled.description: Whether audio is enabled on the camera.

controlEnabled.description:
Whether server manages the camera (changes resolution, FPS, create
profiles, etc).

dewarpingParams.description:
Image dewarping parameters.
The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API
versions.

minArchiveDays.description:
Minimum number of days to keep the archive for.
If the value is less than or equal zero, it is not used.

maxArchiveDays.description:
Maximum number of days to keep the archive for.
If the value is less than or equal zero, it is not used.

preferredServerId.description:
Unique id of a server which has the highest priority of hosting
the camera for failover (if the current server fails).

failoverPriority.description:
Priority for the camera to be moved
to another server for failover (if the current server fails).

backupType.description: Combination (via "|") of the flags defining backup options.

get.description: Read camera list.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id", "physicalId" or "logicalId"
field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not
supported for certain cameras). If omitted, return data for all cameras.

default.description: List of camera information objects in the requested format.

id.description: Camera unique id.

parentId.description: Unique id of the server hosting the camera.

url.description:
Camera IP address, or a complete HTTP URL if the camera was added manually.
Also, for multichannel encoders a complete URL is always used.

typeId.description:
Unique id of the camera type. A camera type can describe predefined
information such as camera maximum resolution, FPS, etc. Detailed type information
can be obtained via GET /ec2/getResourceTypes request.

physicalId.description:
Camera unique identifier. This identifier can used in some requests
related to a camera.

manuallyAdded.description: Whether the user added the camera manually.

groupId.description:
Internal group identifier. It is used for grouping channels of
multi-channel cameras together.

groupName.description: Group name. This name can be changed by users.

statusFlags.description:
Usually this field is zero. Non-zero value indicates that the camera
is causing a lot of network issues.

cameraId.description:
Camera unique id. If such object exists, omitted fields will not be
  changed.

userDefinedGroupName.description: Name of the user-defined camera group.

scheduleEnabled.description: Whether recording to the archive is enabled for the camera.

licenseUsed.description: Whether the license is used for the camera.

motionMask.description:
List of motion detection areas and their
sensitivity. The format is proprietary and is likely to change in
future API versions. Currently, this string defines several rectangles separated
with ":", each rectangle is described by 5 comma-separated numbers: sensitivity,
x and y (for the left top corner), width, height.

scheduleTasks.description:
List of scheduleTask objects which define the camera recording
schedule.

startTime.description:
Time of day when the backup starts (in seconds
passed from 00:00:00).

endTime.description:
Time of day when the backup ends (in seconds passed
from 00:00:00).

dayOfWeek.description: Day of week for the recording task.

beforeThreshold.description:
The number of seconds before a motion event
to record the video for.

afterThreshold.description:
The number of seconds after a motion event to
record the video for.

audioEnabled.description: Whether audio is enabled on the camera.

controlEnabled.description:
Whether server manages the camera (changes resolution, FPS, create
profiles, etc).

dewarpingParams.description:
Image dewarping parameters.
The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API
versions.

minArchiveDays.description:
Minimum number of days to keep the archive for.
If the value is less than or equal to zero, it is not used.

maxArchiveDays.description:
Maximum number of days to keep the archive for.
If the value is less than or equal to zero, it is not used.

preferredServerId.description:
Unique id of a server which has the highest priority of hosting
the camera for failover (if the current server fails).

failoverPriority.description:
Priority for the camera to be moved
to another server for failover (if the current server fails).

backupType.description: Combination (via "|") of the flags defining backup options.

addParams.description:
List of additional parameters for the camera. This list can contain
such information as full ONVIF URL, camera maximum FPS, etc.

get.description: Read current time.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

default.description: Object in the requested format.

get.description: Return all event rules.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Event rule unique id. If omitted, return data for all event rules.

default.description: List of event rule objects in the requested format.

id.description: Event rule unique id.

eventCondition.description:
String containing a JSON object, some fields of which
depend on eventType. Defines the filter for an event to make the rule applicable.
NOTE: Other fields than the described below can be stored in this object, but they
are not used for event matching.

resourceName.description:
Substring to be found in the name of the resource
(e.g. a camera) which caused the event. Empty string matches any value.

inputPortId.description:
(string) Used for input events only. Empty string
matches any value.

caption.description:
Substring to be found in the short event description.
Empty string matches any value.

description.description:
Substring to be found in the long event
description. Empty string matches any value.

actionType.description:
Type of the action. The object fields in actionParams field depend on
this value, as shown in particular values description.

actionParams.description:
String containing a JSON object which fields depend on actionType
and thus are described next to the respective actionType values.

aggregationPeriod.description:
Period (in seconds) during which the consecutive similar events
are aggregated into a single event.

comment.description: An arbitrary comment to the rule.

schedule.description: String containing a lower-case hex array of 21 bytes, which is a bit mask for a week (starting on Monday), where each consecutive bit corresponds to an hour and equals 1 for "enabled" and 0 for "disabled". Thus, the first byte describes the first 8 hours of Monday after midnight, and the last byte describes the last 8 hours of Sunday before midnight; in a byte, the highest significant bit corresponds to the earliest hour. Example: Enable all hours in a week except for the Monday interval from 7am to 9am: fe7fffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff

system.description: Whether the rule is a built-in one, which cannot be deleted.

get.description: Return the recorded chunks info for the specified cameras.

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).
This parameter can be used several times to define a list of cameras.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Start time of the interval (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: End time of the interval (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
This parameter is used for motion search ("periodsType" must be 1). Match motion on a video by specified rectangle.
Format: string with a JSON list of sensors, each sensor is a JSON list of rects, each rect is:
{"x": x, "y": y, "width": width,"height": height}
All values are measured in relative portions of a video frame, x and width in range [0..43], y and height in range [0..31], zero is the left-top corner.
Example of a full-frame rectangle for a single-sensor camera: [[{"x":0,"y":0,"width":43,"height":31}]]
Example of two rectangles for a single-sensor camera: [[{"x":0,"y":0,"width":5,"height":7},{"x":12,"y":10,"width":8,"height":6}]]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Proprietary. Data format. Default value is "json".

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description:
Chunk detail level, in microseconds. Time periods that are
shorter than the detail level are discarded. You can treat the detail level as the
amount of microseconds per screen pixel.

parameters.name: periodsType
parameters.description: Chunk type.

parameters.name: keepSmallChunks
parameters.description:
If specified, standalone chunks smaller than the detail
level are not removed from the result.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of chunks to return.

parameters.name: flat
parameters.description: If specified, do not group chunk lists by server.

default.description:
JSON object with an error code, error message and the list of JSON objects in "reply" field: if no "flat" parameter is specified, "reply" field is the list which contains for each server its GUID (as "guid" field) and the list of chunks (as "periods" field); if "flat" parameter is specified, "reply" field is just the list of chunks.
Each chunk is a pair of (durationMs, startTimeMs). Chunks are merged for all requested cameras. Start time and duration are in milliseconds since epoch. Duration of -1 means the last chunk is being recorded now.

post.description:
Delete the specified layout.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.
post.x-permissions: Administrator, or a user who owns the layout.

id.description: Unique id of the layout to be deleted.

post.description:
Delete the specified layout tour.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description: Unique id of the layout tour to be deleted.

post.description:
Delete the resource.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.
post.x-permissions:
Administrator, or a custom user with "Edit camera settings" permission,
or a user who owns the resource in case the resource is a layout.

id.description: Unique id of the resource.

post.description:
Delete the specified user.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description: User unique id.

post.description:
Delete the specified user role.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description: User role unique id.

post.description:
Delete the specified web page.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description: Web page unique id.

post.description:

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.
post.x-permissions: Administrator, or a custom user with "Edit camera settings" permission.

versions.

minArchiveDays.description:
Minimum number of days to keep the archive for.
If the value is less than or equal to zero, it is not used.

maxArchiveDays.description:
Maximum number of days to keep the archive for.
If the value is less than or equal zero, it is not used.

preferredServerId.description:
Unique id of a server which has the highest priority of hosting
the camera for failover (if the current server fails).

failoverPriority.description:
Priority for the camera to be moved
to another server for failover (if the current server fails).

backupType.description: Combination (via "|") of the flags defining backup options.

post.description:
Save layout.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.
post.x-permissions: Administrator, or a user who owns the layout.

id.description:
Layout unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such object
exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

parentId.description: Unique id of the user owning the layout.

cellAspectRatio.description:
Aspect ratio of a cell for layout items
(floating-point).

id.description: Item unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object.

left.description: Left coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

top.description: Top coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

right.description: Right coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

bottom.description: Bottom coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

rotation.description:
Degree of image tilt; a positive value rotates
counter-clockwise (floating-point, 0..360).

resourcePath.description:
If the item represents a local file - URL of
the file, otherwise is empty.

zoomLeft.description:
Left coordinate of the displayed window inside
the camera image, as a fraction of the image width
(floating-point, 0..1).

zoomTop.description:
Top coordinate of the displayed window inside
the camera image, as a fraction of the image height
(floating-point, 0..1).

zoomRight.description:
Right coordinate of the displayed window inside
the camera image, as a fraction of the image width
(floating-point, 0..1).

zoomBottom.description:
Bottom coordinate of the displayed window inside
the camera image, as a fraction of the image width
(floating-point, 0..1).

zoomTargetId.description:
Unique id of the original layout item for
which the zoom window was created.

contrastParams.description:
Image enhancement parameters. The format
is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions.

dewarpingParams.description:
Image dewarping parameters.
The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API
versions.

displayInfo.description: Whether to display info for the layout item.

backgroundWidth.description: Width of the background image in pixels (integer).

backgroundHeight.description: Height of the background image in pixels (integer).

backgroundOpacity.description:
Level of opacity of the background image in pixels (floating-point
0..1).

post.description:
Save layout tour.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description:
Layout tour unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such
object exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

items.description: List of the layout tour items.

resourceId.description: Resource unique id. Can be a layout or a camera or something else.

delayMs.description: Delay between layouts switching in milliseconds.

post.description:
Save the list of layouts.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON array of objects in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description:
Layout unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such object
exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

parentId.description: Unique id of the user owning the layout.

cellAspectRatio.description:
Aspect ratio of a cell for layout items
(floating-point).

id.description: Item unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object.

left.description: Left coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

top.description: Top coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

right.description: Right coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

bottom.description: Bottom coordinate of the layout item (floating-point).

rotation.description:
Degree of image tilt; a positive value rotates
counter-clockwise (floating-point, 0..360).

resourcePath.description:
If the item represents a local file - URL of
the file, otherwise is empty.

zoomLeft.description:
Left coordinate of the displayed window inside
the camera image, as a fraction of the image width
(floating-point, 0..1).

zoomTop.description:
Top coordinate of the displayed window inside
the camera image, as a fraction of the image height
(floating-point, 0..1).

zoomRight.description:
Right coordinate of the displayed window inside
the camera image, as a fraction of the image width
(floating-point, 0..1).

zoomBottom.description:
Bottom coordinate of the displayed window inside
the camera image, as a fraction of the image width
(floating-point, 0..1).

zoomTargetId.description:
Unique id of the original layout item for
which the zoom window was created.

contrastParams.description:
Image enhancement parameters. The format
is proprietary and is likely to change in future API versions.

dewarpingParams.description:
Image dewarping parameters.
The format is proprietary and is likely to change in future API
versions.

displayInfo.description: Whether to display info for the layout item.

backgroundWidth.description: Width of the background image in pixels (integer).

backgroundHeight.description: Height of the background image in pixels (integer).

backgroundOpacity.description:
Level of opacity of the background image in pixels (floating-point
0..1).

post.description:
Save additional attributes of a server.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

serverId.description: Server unique id. If such object exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

maxCameras.description: Maximum number of cameras on the server.

allowAutoRedundancy.description:
Whether the server can take cameras from
an offline server automatically.

backupDaysOfTheWeek.description:
Combination (via "|") of the days of week on which the backup is
active.

backupStart.description: Time of day when the backup starts (in seconds passed from 00:00:00).

backupDuration.description: Duration of the synchronization period (in seconds). -1 if not set.

backupBitrate.description:
Maximum backup bitrate (in bytes per second). Negative
value if not limited.

post.description:
Save additional attributes of a number of servers.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON array of objects in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

serverId.description: Server unique id. If such object exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

maxCameras.description: Maximum number of cameras on the server.

allowAutoRedundancy.description:
Whether the server can take cameras from
an offline server automatically.

backupDaysOfTheWeek.description:
Combination (via "|") of weekdays
the backup is active on.

backupStart.description: Time of day when the backup starts (in seconds passed from 00:00:00).

backupDuration.description: Duration of the synchronization period (in seconds). -1 if not set.

backupBitrate.description:
Maximum backup bitrate (in bytes per second). Negative
value if not limited.

post.description:
Save the storage.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description: Storage unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object.

url.description: Must be full storage url (path to the local folder).

spaceLimit.description:
Free space to maintain on the storage,
in bytes. Recommended value is 10 gigabytes for local storages and
100 gigabytes for NAS.

usedForWriting.description: Whether writing to the storage is allowed.

storageType.description: Type of the method to access the storage.

addParams.description:
List of storage additional parameters. Intended for
internal use; leave empty when creating a new storage.

isBackup.description: Whether the storage is used for backup.

post.description: Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description:
User unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such object
exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

isAdmin.description: Proprietary. Indended for internal use; keep the value when saving a previously received object, use false when creating a new one.

digest.description: HA1 digest hash from user password, as per RFC 2069. When modifying an existing user, supply empty string. When creating a new user, calculate the value based on UTF-8 password as follows: digest = md5_hex(user_name + ":" + realm + ":" + password);

hash.description: User's password hash. When modifying an existing user, supply empty string. When creating a new user, calculate the value based on UTF-8 password as follows: salt = rand_hex(); hash = "md5$" + salt + "$" + md5_hex(salt + password);

cryptSha512Hash.description:
Cryptography key hash. Supply empty string
when creating, keep the value when modifying.

realm.description:
HTTP authorization realm as defined in RFC 2617, can be obtained via
/api/gettime.

isLdap.description: Whether the user was imported from LDAP.

isCloud.description: Whether the user is a cloud user, as opposed to a local one.

post.description: Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description:
User role unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such
object exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

post.description:
Saves the list of users. Only local and LDAP users are supported. Cloud users won't be saved.

Parameters should be passed as a JSON array of objects in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description:
User unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such object
exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

isAdmin.description: Proprietary. Indended for internal use; keep the value when saving a previously received object, use false when creating a new one.

digest.description: HA1 digest hash from user password, as per RFC 2069. When modifying an existing user, supply empty string. When creating a new user, calculate the value based on UTF-8 password as follows: digest = md5_hex(user_name + ":" + realm + ":" + password);

hash.description: User's password hash. When modifying an existing user, supply empty string. When creating a new user, calculate the value based on UTF-8 password as follows: salt = rand_hex(); hash = "md5$" + salt + "$" + md5_hex(salt + password);

cryptSha512Hash.description:
Cryptography key hash. Supply empty string
when creating, keep the value when modifying.

realm.description:
HTTP authorization realm as defined in RFC 2617, can be obtained via
/api/gettime.

isLdap.description: Whether the user was imported from LDAP.

isCloud.description: Whether the user is a cloud user, as opposed to a local one.

post.description: Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

id.description:
Web page unique id. Can be omitted when creating a new object. If such object
exists, omitted fields will not be changed.

post.description: Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of the corresponding GET function.

get.description:
Proprietary.

Get free space available for downloading and extracting update files.

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present, the request should not be redirected to another server.

parameters.name: extraFormatting
parameters.description: Proprietary. If present and the requested result format is non-binary, indentation and spacing will be used to improve readability.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Data format. Default value is "json".

default.description:
The amount of free space available for update files in bytes for each online server
in the system, in the specified format.

get.description: Activate new license and return license JSON data if success

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: License serial number

default.description: JSON data.

get.description:
This function allows to execute several requests with json content type and returns result
as a single JSON object

parameters.name: exec_cmd
parameters.description:
HTTP url path to execute. This parameter could be repeated
several times to execute several nested methods. All additions parameters after current
"exec_cmd" and before next "exec_cmd" are passed as parameters to the nested method.

default.description: Merged JSON data from nested methods.

get.description: Return audit log information in the requested format.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time of a time interval (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time of a time interval(as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

default.description: Tail of the server log file in text format

get.description: Start or stop the recorded data backup process, also can report this process status.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: What to do and what to report about the backup process.

default.description: Bakcup process progress status or an error code.

get.description: Back up server database.

default.description: JSON with error code.

post.description: Change password for already existing user on a camera.

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User name.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: New password to set.

default.description: JSON result with error code

post.description: Configure various server parameters.

parameters.name: systemName
parameters.description: System display name. It affects all servers in the system.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Server API port. It affects the current server only.

default.description:
JSON with error code, error string, and flag "restartNeeded" that shows whether the
server must be restarted to apply settings. Error string contains a hint to identify the
problem: "SYSTEM_NAME" or "PORT".

get.description:
Using this method it is possible to trigger a generic event in the system from a 3rd party system. Such event will be handled and logged according to current event rules. Parameters of the generated event, such as "source", "caption" and "description", are intended to be analyzed by these rules.
Example: 
http://127.0.0.1:7001/api/createEvent?timestamp=2016-09-16T16:02:41Z&caption=CreditCardUsed&metadata={"cameraRefs":["3A4AD4EA-9269-4B1F-A7AA-2CEC537D0248","3A4AD4EA-9269-4B1F-A7AA-2CEC537D0240"]}
This example triggers a generic event informing the system that a credit card has been used on September 16, 2016 at 16:03:41 UTC in a POS terminal being watched by the two specified cameras.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Event date and time (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). If "timestamp" is absent, the current server date and time is used.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Name of the device which has triggered the event. It can be used
in a filter in event rules to assign different actions to different devices. Also, the
user could see this name in the notifications panel. Example: "POS terminal 5".

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description:
Short event description. It can be used in a filter in event
rules to assign actions depending on this text.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description:
Long event description. It can be used as a filter in event
rules to assign actions depending on this text.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description:
Additional information associated with the event, in the form of a JSON object. Currently this object can specify the only field "cameraRefs", but other fields could be added in the future.
  • "cameraRefs" specifies a number of cameras which are linked to the event (e.g. the event will appear on their timelines), in the form of a list of camera ids (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting).

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
Generic events can be used either with "long" actions like
"do recording", or instant actions like "send email". This parameter should be specified
in case "long" actions are going to be used with generic events.

default.description: JSON result with error code.

post.description:
Detach media server from cloud. Local admin user is enabled, admin password is changed to
new value (if specified), all cloud users are disabled. Cloud link is removed. Function can
be called either via GET or POST method. POST data should be a json object.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Set new admin password after detach.

default.description: JSON result with error code

get.description: Return a list of the discovered peers.

default.description: JSON with a list of the discovered peers.

get.description: Performs camera diagnostics.

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Diagnostics to perform.

default.description: JSON object with an error code, error message and diagnostics result.

get.description:
Proprietary.

Return event log in the proprietary binary format.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start of time period (in milliseconds since epoch).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of time period (in milliseconds since epoch).

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: Event type.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action type.

parameters.name: brule_id
parameters.description: Event rule id.

default.description: Server event log in the proprietary binary format.

get.description:
Proprietary.

Execute any script from subfolder "scripts" of media server. Script name provides directly in a URL path like "/api/execute/script1.sh". All URL parameters are passed directly to a script as an parameters.

default.description: JSON with error code.

get.description:
Read camera parameters. For instance: brightness, contrast e.t.c. Parameters to read should
be specified.

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

parameters.name: <any_name>
parameters.description:
Parameter name to read. Request can contain one or more
parameters.

default.description:
Required parameter values in form of paramName=paramValue, each parameter on
a new line.

get.description: Get server event log information.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time of a time interval (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time of a time interval (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via
/ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for
certain cameras). Used to filter events log by a single camera.

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: Filter events log by specified event type.

parameters.name: action_type
parameters.description: Filter events log by specified action type.

parameters.name: brule_id
parameters.description:
Filter events log by specified event rule (keep only records
generated via that event rule). This id could be obtained via /ec2/getEventRules.

default.description:
JSON with an error code, error message and a list of JSON objects in "reply"
field:

actionParams.description:
JSON object with action parameters. Only fields that are
applicable to the particular action are used.

actionResourceId.description:
Additional parameter for event log
convenience.

recordingDuration.description:
Duration of the recording, in
seconds.

recordAfter.description:
For Bookmark, extension to the recording
time, in seconds.

text.description:
Text for Show Text Overlay, or message body for
Exec HTTP Action.

durationMs.description:
Duration in milliseconds for Bookmark and
Show Text Overlay.

additionalResources.description:
JSON list of ids of additional
resources; user ids for Show On Alarm Layout.

forced.description: Alarm Layout - if it must be opened immediately.

useSource.description:
Alarm Layout - if the source resource should
also be used.

recordBeforeMs.description:
Bookmark start time is adjusted to the
left by this value in milliseconds.

eventTimestampUsec.description:
When did the event occur, in
microseconds.

eventResourceId.description: Event source - camera or server id.

resourceName.description:
Name of the resource which caused the event.
Used if no resource is actually registered in the system. Generic event can
provide some resource name which doesn't match any resourceId in the system. In
this case resourceName is filled and resourceId remains empty.

sourceServerId.description: Id of a server that generated the event.

reasonCode.description: Used in Reasoned Events as a reason code.

caption.description:
Short event description. Used for camera/server
conflict as resource name which cause error. Used in generic events as a short
description.

description.description:
Long event description. Used for
camera/server conflict as a long description (conflict list). Used in Reasoned
Events as reason description. Used in generic events as a long description.

metadata.description:
Camera list which is associated with the
event. EventResourceId may be a POS terminal, but this is a camera list which
should be shown with this event.

aggregationCount.description: Number of identical events groupped into one.

get.description: Return the list of Hardware Ids of the server.

default.description:
JSON with an error code, error message and a list of strings in "reply"
field.

get.description:
Proprietary.

Get hardware information

default.description: JSON with hardware information.

get.description: Return authentication parameters: "nonce" and "realm".

default.description:
A JSON object with an error code, error message, and the list of JSON
objects in "reply" field:

realm.description: A string token used in authentication methods as "realm".

nonce.description:
A session key for the current user. The current server time is used
as a nonce value, and the nonce is valid for about 5 minutes.

get.description: Return the complete list of time zones supported by the server machine.

default.description:
JSON object with an error code, error message, and the list of JSON objects
in "reply" field:

displayName.description: Time zone verbose name in English.

hasDaylightTime.description: Whether the time zone has the DST feature.

id.description: Time zone identifier, to be used for e.g. /api/setTime.

isDaylightTime.description:
Whether the time zone is on DST right now. To be reported
properly, the server machine should have the correct current time set.

offsetFromUtc.description: Time zone offset from UTC (in seconds).

get.description:
Return server time (in milliseconds since epoch), time zone and authentication realm (realm
is added for convenience)

default.description: JSON data.

post.description:
Set new network settings (list of interfaces) for the server. Can be called only if server flags include "SF_IfListCtrl" (server flags can be obtained via /ec2/getMediaServersEx in "flags" field).

Parameters should be passed as a JSON array of objects in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object can be seen in the result of GET /api/iflist function.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Interface name.

parameters.name: ipAddr
parameters.description: IP address with dot-separated decimal components.

parameters.name: netMask
parameters.description: Network mask with dot-separated decimal components.

parameters.name: mac
parameters.description: MAC address with colon-separated upper-case hex components.

parameters.name: gateway
parameters.description:
IP address of the gateway with dot-separated decimal components. Can
be empty.

parameters.name: extraParams
parameters.description: JSON object with data in the internal format.

parameters.name: dns_servers
parameters.description:
Space-separated list of IP addresses with dot-separated decimal
components.

get.description:
Get network settings (list of interfaces) for the server. Can be called only if server flags
include "SF_IfListCtrl" (server flags can be obtained via /ec2/getMediaServersEx in
"flags" field).

default.description: List of objects with interface parameters.

ipAddr.description: IP address with dot-separated decimal components.

netMask.description: Network mask with dot-separated decimal components.

mac.description: MAC address with colon-separated upper-case hex components.

gateway.description:
IP address of the gateway with dot-separated decimal components.
Can be empty.

extraParams.description: JSON object with data in the internal format.

dns_servers.description:
Space-separated list of IP addresses with dot-separated
decimal components.

post.description:
Proprietary.

Updates server by the package contained in POST body

get.description: Get or set server log level.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Log id

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
Target value for log level. More detailed level includes all less
detailed levels.

get.description:
Proprietary.

Manually add camera(s). If several cameras are added, parameters "url" and "manufacturer" must be defined several times with incrementing suffix "0", "1", etc.

parameters.name: url0
parameters.description:
Camera url, can be obtained from "reply.cameras[].url" field in the
result of /api/manualCamera/status.

parameters.name: uniqueId0
parameters.description:
Camera physical id, can be obtained from "reply.cameras[].uniqueId"
field in the result of /api/manualCamera/status.

parameters.name: manufacturer0
parameters.description:
Camera manufacturer, can be obtained from
"reply.cameras[].manufacturer" field in the result of /api/manualCamera/status.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Username for the cameras.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password for the cameras.

default.description: JSON object with error message and error code (0 means OK).

post.description:
Manually add camera(s).

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object: 


{
    "user": "some_user",
    "password": "some_password",
    "cameras":
    [
        {
            "uniqueId": "00-1A-07-00-FF-FF",
            "url": "192.168.0.100",
            "manufacturer": "3100"
        }
    ]
}

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Username for the cameras.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password for the cameras.

parameters.name: cameras
parameters.description: List of objects with fields defined below.

parameters.name: cameras[].url
parameters.description:
Camera url, can be obtained from "reply.cameras[].url"
field in the result of /api/manualCamera/status.

parameters.name: cameras[].uniqueId
parameters.description:
Camera physical id, can be obtained from
"reply.cameras[].uniqueId" field in the result of /api/manualCamera/status.

parameters.name: cameras[].manufacturer
parameters.description:
Camera manufacturer, can be obtained from
"reply.cameras[].manufacturer" field in the result of /api/manualCamera/status.

default.description: JSON object with error message and error code (0 means OK).

get.description: Start searching for the cameras in manual mode.

parameters.name: start_ip
parameters.description: First IP address in the range to scan.

parameters.name: end_ip
parameters.description: Last IP address in the range to scan.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description:
Camera(s) IP port to check. Port is auto-detected if this
parameter is omitted.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Camera(s) username.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Camera(s) password.

default.description:
JSON object with the initial status of camera search process, including
processUuid used for other /api/manualCamera calls, and the list of objects describing
cameras found to the moment.

get.description: Get the current status of the process of searching for the cameras.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description:
Process unique id, can be obtained from "processUuid" field in the result
of /api/manualCamera/search.

default.description:
JSON object with the initial status of camera search process, including
processUuid used for other /api/manualCamera calls, and the list of objects describing
cameras found to the moment.

post.description: Stop manual adding progress.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description:
Process unique id, can be obtained from "processUuid" field in the result
of /api/manualCamera/search.

default.description: JSON object with error message and error code (0 means OK).

post.description:
Merge two Systems.
The System that joins another System is called the current System, the joinable System is called the target System. The URL parameter sets the target Server which should be joined with the current System. Other servers, that are merged with the target Server will be joined if parameter mergeOneServer is set to false.
The method uses digest authentication. Two hashes should be previouly calculated: getKey and postKey. Both are mandatory. The calculation algorithm is described in Calculating authentication hash section (in the bootom of the page). While calculating hashes, username and password of the target Server are needed. Digest authentication needs realm and nonce, both can be obtained with GET /api/getNonce call call. The lifetime of a nonce is about a few minutes.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of one Server in the System to join.

parameters.name: getKey
parameters.description: Authentication hash of the target Server for GET requests.

parameters.name: postKey
parameters.description: Authentication hash of the target Server for POST requests.

parameters.name: takeRemoteSettings
parameters.description: Direction of the merge. Default value is false. If mergeOneServer is true, takeRemoteSettings parameter is ignored and treated as false.

parameters.name: mergeOneServer
parameters.description: Whether to merge with servers merged with the target server. Default value is false. If mergeOneServer is set to true, takeRemoteSettings is ignored and treated as false.

parameters.name: ignoreIncompatible
parameters.description:
Whether to ignore different version of merged server
protocols. Default value is false.

default.description:
JSON with error code and error string. Error string could be empty in case
of successful ping, "FAIL" if the specified system is unreachable or there is no system,
"UNAUTHORIZED" if the authentication credentials are invalid, "INCOMPATIBLE" if the
found system has incompatible version or different customization, and "BACKUP_ERROR" if
database backup could not been created.

get.description: Get information about the server.

parameters.name: allModules
parameters.description: Set it to true to get all modules from the system.

parameters.name: showAddresses
parameters.description: Set it to true to show server addresses.

default.description: JSON object with module information.

get.description: The same as moduleInformation but requires authentication. Useful to test connection.

default.description: JSON object with module information.

get.description: Ping the server

default.description:
JSON with error code, error string and module unique id in case of
successful ping.

get.description: Ping the system.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: System URL to ping.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: System administrator password.

default.description:
JSON with error code, error string and module information in case of
successful ping. Error string could be empty in case of successful ping, "FAIL" if the
specified system is unreachable or there is no any system, "UNAUTHORIZED" if the
authentication credentials are invalid, and "INCOMPATIBLE" if the found system has
incompatible version or different customization.

get.description: Perform reading or writing PTZ operation

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: PTZ operation

default.description: JSON object with an error code (0 means OK) and error message.

get.description: Start or stop the server archive rebuilding, also can report this process status.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: What to do and what to report about the server archive rebuild.

parameters.name: mainPool
parameters.description: 1 (for the main storage) or 0 (for the backup storage)

default.description: Rebuild progress status or an error code.

get.description: Restarts the server.

default.description: JSON with error code.

post.description:
Proprietary.

Restore server state to default. Cleans database and system name.

parameters.name: oldPassword
parameters.description: Current admin password

default.description: JSON result with an error code and an error string.

post.description: Sets or resets cloud credentials (systemId and authorization key) to be used by system

get.description:
Proprietary.

Return list of scripts to execute.

default.description: JSON object with string list.

post.description:
Sets values of several camera parameters. This parameters are used on the Advanced tab in
camera settings. For instance: brightness, contrast e.t.c.

parameters.name: cameraId
parameters.description:
Camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or
/ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not supported for certain cameras).

parameters.name: <any_name>
parameters.description:
Parameter for camera to set. Request can contain one or more
parameters to set.

default.description:
"OK" if all parameters have been set, otherwise return error 500 (Internal
server error) and the result of setting for every parameter.

post.description:
Set current time on the server machine. Can be called only if server flags include "SF_timeCtrl" (server flags can be obtained via /ec2/getMediaServersEx in "flags" field).

Parameters should be passed as a JSON object in POST message body with content type "application/json". Example of such object: 


{
    "dateTime": "2015-02-28T16:37:00",
    "timeZoneId": "Europe/Moscow"
}

parameters.name: timeZoneId
parameters.description: Time zone identifier, can be obtained via /api/getTimeZones.

parameters.name: dateTime
parameters.description: Date and time (as string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

get.description:
Proprietary.

Set current time on the server machine. Can be called only if server flags include "SF_timeCtrl" (server flags can be obtained via /ec2/getMediaServersEx in "flags" field).

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Time zone identifier, can be obtained via /api/getTimeZones.

parameters.name: datetime
parameters.description: System date and time (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

post.description:
Configure server system name and attach it to cloud. This function can be called for server
with default system name. Otherwise function returns error. This method requires owner
permissions.

parameters.name: systemName
parameters.description: New system name

parameters.name: cloudAuthKey
parameters.description: could authentication key

parameters.name: cloudSystemID
parameters.description: could system id

default.description: JSON result with error code

post.description:
Configure server system name and password. This function can be called for server with
default system name. Otherwise function returns error. This method requires owner
permissions.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: New password for admin user

parameters.name: systemName
parameters.description: New system name

default.description: JSON result with error code

get.description: Return tail of the server log file

parameters.name: lines
parameters.description: Display last N log lines.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of log file. By default main log is returned

default.description: Tail of the server log file in text format

get.description: Return server info: CPU usage, HDD usage e.t.c.

default.description: JSON data with statistics.

get.description: Return a list of all server storages.

default.description: JSON data with server storages.

get.description: Check if specified folder can be used as a server storage.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Folder to check.

default.description:
JSON data. "OK" if specified folder may be used for writing on the server.
Otherwise returns "FAIL"

get.description:
Get or set global system settings. If called with no arguments, just returns list of all
system settings with their values

parameters.name: <param_name>
parameters.description: name of system parameter. E.g., ec2AliveUpdateIntervalSec

parameters.name: <param_value>
parameters.description: New value for the specified parameter

default.description:
malloc_info(3) output. See https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man3/malloc_info.3.html
for details.

trace.description:
Open RTSP video stream from a camera.
                        It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain
                        any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not
                        supported for certain cameras).
                        Example:
                        rtsp://<server_ip>:<port>/12AB42FD5912?pos=1235631&resolution=240p

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: By default, the server opens a camera at the live position. This parameter defines position in an archive (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). Position can be passed via standard RTSP attribute as well as via URL parameter

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description:
Turn on video transcoding to the specified resolution. Resolution string either may contain width and height (for instance 320x240) or
                                                        height only (for instance 240p)

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.description:
Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees. If the parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog.
                                         Parameter take place if video transcoding is activated (parameter codec and/or parameter resolution are presents.)

parameters.name: codec
parameters.description: Defines video codec used for transcoding. Default value is H263.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description:
Open high quality stream if parameter is 0 or low quality stream if parameter is 1.
                                         By default server auto detect preferred stream index based on destination resolution.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Playback speed. Only values in range [1..32] are supported. Default value is 1.

default.description: RTSP video stream.

get.description:
Open HTTP video stream from a camera.
                        It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain
                        any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not
                        supported for certain cameras).
                        Codec and stream format can be specified in URL parameters. Live stream and
                        archive can be downloaded. If required and possible, media stream
                        transcoding is performed on-the-fly. Stream format can be one of the
                        following: webm, mpegts, mpjpeg (motion jpeg).
                        Example:
                        http://<server_ip>:<port>/media/12AB42FD5912.webm

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Video stream resolution. Example: 720x576, 1920x1080, 720p, 1080p. By default, 640x480 is used

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: If present and not equal to <now>, specifies archive stream start position (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). Otherwise, LIVE stream is provided

parameters.name: endPos
parameters.description: If present, specifies archive stream end position (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected). It is used only if "pos" parameter is present.

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.description: Rotate item. Can be 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees. If the parameter is absent, video will be rotated to default value defined in a camera settings dialog.

parameters.name: sfd
parameters.description: Stand Frame Duration. If the parameter is present, video speed is limited by real time.

parameters.name: rt
parameters.description: Turn on realtime optimization. It will drop some frames if not enough CPU for realtime transcoding.

default.description: Video stream in the requested format

get.description:
Open HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) video stream from a camera.
                        It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain
                        any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not
                        supported for certain cameras).
                        This protocol is supported by iOS-based devices (iPhone, iPad).
                        Example:
                        http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.m3u

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Camera archive position to open (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

parameters.name: hi
parameters.description: If specified, only hi quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

parameters.name: lo
parameters.description: If specified, only low quality is available on streaming session. If neither <hi> nor <lo> is specified than HLS client is allowed to perform dynamic stream switching (to fit in available bandwidth and compensate for traffic congestion)

default.description: Video stream in mpeg-2/ts format

get.description:
Download fragment of a camera archive, identified by its start time and
                        duration.
                        It is not exactly an API method but rather a URL format which may contain
                        any camera id (can be obtained from "id" field via /ec2/getCamerasEx or /ec2/getCameras?extraFormatting) or MAC address (not
                        supported for certain cameras).
                        Fragment can be downloaded in mpeg-2/ts (.ts) or Matroska (.mkv) format.
                        No transcoding is performed. Stream format can be one of following: ts, mkv.
                        Example:
                        http://<server_ip>:<port>/hls/12AB42FD5912.mkv?startDatetime=2015-02-05T19:00&duration=10

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Fragment start time (as a string containing time in milliseconds since epoch, or a local time formatted like "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.zzz" - the format is auto-detected).

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Fragment length in seconds

parameters.name: hi
parameters.description: Return high quality stream

parameters.name: lo
parameters.description: Return low quality stream

default.description: Video stream in the requested format

get.description:
Proxy methods allows to send any request to any server using the existing public connection. Can also be used to get video streams.
                        Example: rtsp://10.0.2.1/proxy/rtsp/{72934575-ceb7-54bb-23a0-84b81cf1d3f1}/12AB42FD5912?pos=1235631&resolution=240p
                        Example: http://10.0.2.1/proxy/http/{72934575-ceb7-54bb-23a0-84b81cf1d3f1}/showLog

default.description: Result of the target API request.

options.description:
This method is preferable for external applications, most of HTTP libraries support it.
Server is fully conformant with the authentication defined in rfc2617 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2617).

This method should only be used in browser javascript applications.
Cookie authorization scheme allows to avoid standard login/password dialog in web-applications.
It provides you a way to replace it with your own dialog.
It works mostly like sessions, but is a bit more secure because it doesn't send user's password over HTTP.
  • To check authentication:
    1. Call GET /api/getCurrentUser
    2. You will get 401 (Unauthorised) in case you need authorization
    3. You will get 200 (OK) and the user object otherwise
  • To log in:
    1. Call GET /api/getNonce
    2. In response you'll get a JSON object with realm and nonce (nonce is a session key for this user)
    3. Calculate authentication hash auth_digest, using realm and nonce (see algorithm below)
    4. Call POST /api/cookieLogin and pass the "auth" parameter in the json request body
    5. Server will check authentication and set session cookies
  • Executing requests:
    1. Session cookie should be supplied with every request, browser does it automatically if cookies are enabled
    2. HTTP header Nx-Vms-Csrf-Token should contain the key from nx-vms-csrf-token cookie value
  • To log out:
    1. Call POST /api/cookieLogout
    2. Server will clear the session cookies

This method should only be used if other methods are not applicable, e.g. webm direct link.
Add the "auth" parameter to the URL query section of any GET request
  • Call /api/getNonce to get realm and nonce from the server (the current server time is used as a nonce value, and the nonce is valid for about 5 minutes)
  • Calculate the authentication hash auth_digest, using realm and nonce (see algorithm below)
  • Specify the authentication hash in the URL parameter: http://127.0.0.1:7001/method?auth=auth_digest&other_params

For URL-based authentication and cookie-based authentication you need to calculate the hash manually, using the following algorithm:
  • Call GET /api/getNonce
  • In response you'll get a JSON object with realm and nonce
  • Translate user's username to the lower case
  • Check the required method ("GET" for HTTP GET requests, "POST" for HTTP POST requests, "PLAY" for RTSP etc)
  • digest = md5_hex(user_name + ":" + realm + ":" + password)
  • partial_ha2 = md5_hex(method + ":")
  • simplified_ha2 = md5_hex(digest + ":" + nonce + ":" + partial_ha2)
  • auth_digest = base64(user_name + ":" + nonce + ":" + simplified_ha2)
  • Here auth_digest is the required authentication hash
